intro: Fumaria judaica var. microstachys, commonly known as the Jewish gloryflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, nodding yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East, it thrives in well-drained soils and sunny to partially shaded locations. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
